go_data.justification: IFN-alpha is involved in anti-viral innate immunity by blocking virus replication and alerting neighbouring cells to the danger of infection.
Type I IFNs, including IFN-alpha, promote adaptive immune responses by priming T helper cells and cytotoxic T cells.
IFN-alpha acts to block virus replication as part of the innate immune response.
IFN-alpha is a type of cytokine that acts in an autocrine and paracrine manner.
